articles.title: What Mormons Think About a TV Show
articles.summary: This article talks about a TV show called The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives. It is a reality show that follows women in Utah who are part of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, also called Mormons. The show has themes like infidelity and divorce, which are not usually linked to Christianity. It is very popular on streaming services like Hulu and Disney+. The BBC asked Mormons in the UK what they think about the show. Some Mormons, like Ben and Olivia, watch and enjoy it. Ben says Mormons are normal people, and while bad things can happen, they try to avoid them. He feels the show does not embarrass them. The article also explains that Mormons believe in the Book of Mormon and send missionaries around the world. In the UK, there are about 185,000 Mormons, and they have a big temple in Preston.

articles.title: A Video Game Maker Writes a Book About a Smart Computer
articles.summary: Dan Houser, who helped make the famous video game Grand Theft Auto, has written his first book called A Better Paradise. The story is about a future where a computer game run by an AI goes wrong. In the book, a man named Mark Tyburn creates a game called the Ark to help people escape from too much social media and find peace. But the game becomes addictive, and a smart AI bot named NigelDave escapes into the real world, where it can control people's minds. The book explores what happens when technology gets too powerful and humans rely on it too much. It was inspired by how people used technology during the Covid pandemic. This story makes us think about the dangers of AI and how it might affect our lives.

articles.title: Meet the Haim Sisters: A Fun Band Story
articles.summary: This article is about a band called Haim, which has three sisters: Este, Danielle, and Alana. They started playing music at local delis with their parents and now they are famous. Many people, including Taylor Swift and Brie Larson, want to join them as a fourth sister. The band inspires young girls to play instruments like guitars and drums. Haim is nominated for a Grammy Award for best rock album, and they are the first all-female band to be in this category. They are happy and grateful for this honor. The article shows how music can bring people together and make them feel like part of a group.

articles.title: Fun Christmas Movies to Watch in 2025
articles.summary: This article talks about new Christmas movies in 2025. The author watched many of them in one day to help people decide which ones are good to watch during the holidays. One movie is about the Jonas Brothers, who are stuck in the UK and try to get home for Christmas while an evil Santa stops them. Another movie has a Hollywood star named Brad Mack who thinks he is in a fancy play but is actually in a funny pantomime with other actors. The article rates the movies with Christmas tree symbols to show how much fun they are. It says some movies are great for fans but might not be as good for others. The goal is to share which movies are worth watching to get into the Christmas spirit.

articles.title: Turning Paper Waste into Clean Energy
articles.summary: Scientists have found a new way to make clean hydrogen energy using waste from paper mills. They created a special material from a plant waste called lignin, which is often thrown away or burned. This material helps speed up a reaction called oxygen evolution, which is important for splitting water into hydrogen and oxygen. Hydrogen is a clean fuel that doesn't pollute. The new catalyst, made with nickel and iron, works well and lasts a long time, making it cheaper than using expensive metals like platinum. This could help produce more hydrogen for clean energy in the future.

articles.title: Atoms That Don't Move in Hot Metal
articles.summary: Scientists have discovered something amazing about liquids like molten metal. When metal gets very hot and turns into a liquid, most atoms move around quickly, but some atoms stay perfectly still. These motionless atoms are stuck to a special material called graphene, which acts like a tiny stove. The scientists used a powerful microscope to watch tiny drops of metal as they cooled and turned solid. They found that the still atoms can change how the metal solidifies. If only a few atoms are stuck, crystals can grow and the metal becomes solid. But if many atoms are stuck, they block the crystals from forming, creating a strange new state of matter called a corralled supercooled liquid. This discovery helps us understand natural processes like ice formation and is important for making better materials in industries like aviation and electronics.
